pages.body:
Section13 Charter
===
![image](images/banner.jpg)

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]]  

-------------------------------
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////Charter////////////////////////////

Section13 (s13) is an online gaming community with a focus on teamwork. There's a simple rank and structure to keep and maintain order. Members are expected to follow our core principles. To protect the integrity of our community we've established the following.

* Voice chat is required.

* Members will follow a chain of command. 

* Members will treat each other with respect and promote fellowship within the community.

* Command will be fair and consistent in how they manage the crew.

* Members will not cheat. 

\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\End Transmission\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\

Section13 Manifesto
===
![image](images/banner.jpg)

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]]  

-------------------------------

“A nation can survive its fools, and even the ambitious. But it cannot survive treason from within. An enemy at the gates is less formidable, for he is known and carries his banner openly. But the traitor moves amongst those within the gate freely, his sly whispers rustling through all the alleys, heard in the very halls of government itself. For the traitor appears not a traitor; he speaks in accents familiar to his victims, and he wears their face and their arguments, he appeals to the baseness that lies deep in the hearts of all men. He rots the soul of a nation, he works secretly and unknown in the night to undermine the pillars of the city, he infects the body politic so that it can no longer resist. A murderer is less to fear.”

― Marcus Tullius Cicero

The history of our organization.
===
![image](images/banner.jpg)

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]]

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]] | [[Mumble]] | [[Access]]

Download RetroShare: [here](https://retroshare.net)

Note: You'll have to select advance and add the security exception if your browser prompts you to do so.

Section13 Mumble Server
===
![image](images/banner.jpg)

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]] | [[Mumble]] | [[Access]]  

-------------------------------

Server Address:  45.76.12.46

![image](images/mumble.png)

Section13 Manifesto
===
![image](images/banner.jpg)

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]] | [[Mumble]] | [[Access]]  

-------------------------------

In the backwards world where we know the price of everything yet value nothing. Where does one go to escape the bonds that shackle them to a reality that was created as a voluntary prison. A prison one would openly embrace if the price was right. Does true freedom exist in a world dominated by UEE surveillance[[?]]

Brothers and Sisters of the universe. You are more powerful then what society would have you believe. More beautiful then the anorexic images that model the latest fashions to destroy your self esteem for profit, and total supremacy of independent thought.

When your innocence was destroyed by the addition of chemicals introduced into the “food” supply. Leaving you docile and susceptible to the mental manipulations from local, state, and federally funded media outlets. The world around you became corrupt.

The level of corruption is hard to quantify because it’s so rampant in our society. It’s easy to see how generations of people have been programmed at birth to accept what they see on state run media. Can we honestly say that we’re programming our people with the right types of messages.

Where did all of our citizen’s go? Will the plebs just stand by and allow this injustice to continue?

When using words such as griefer, troll, or dare I say PIRATE! Why is there this attitude of intolerance, hate, and avoidance. Have we as a society become so castrated that we can’t stand up for what we truly believe in anymore?

And the perpetual victim mentality, lolz. Were you really victimized by what someone said on the internet?

“You” people, and you know who I’m taking about here. Talk about this love, and acceptance, and brotherhood even. Yet it’s people like myself – as well as others who have had the courage to stand up for what we believe in. That are called trolls and pay the ultimate price. Banning a “troll” for disagreeing with what they have said is not the way you foster good community relations.

In fact, any and all attempts to “sanitize” our perspective will in fact empower us to go further. This level of hate that stems from the ignorance of our cause will only cast us as the evil we’ve always been. For you see our evil is of course yours as well. Only we have no issue with letting you in on our shared secret.

If your eyes should glance upon this text and it resonates with how you feel. There is a place for you with a pirate crew.

Our people are watched over by our patron saint. May she guide you along your journey.

A prayer to our patron St. Joan of Arc

“In the face of your enemies, in the face of harassment, ridicule, and doubt, you held firm in your faith. Even in your abandonment, alone and without friends, you held firm in your faith. Even as you faced your own mortality, you held firm in your faith. I pray that I may be as bold in my beliefs as you, St. Joan. I ask that you ride alongside me in my own battles. Help me be mindful that what is worthwhile can be won when I persist. Help me hold firm in my faith. Help me believe in my ability to act well and wisely. Amen.”

The history of our organization.
===
![image](images/banner.jpg)

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]] | [[Mumble]] | [[Access]]  

-------------------------------

Outcast from the community since inception, Section13 attempted to carve out an identity for itself in a number of ways. In what seemed like a perpetual state of re-branding we eventually came back to our roots.

Knowing that the universe was against us, we decided to operate our own pirate military corporation. Currently in development we’ve gathered some support from individuals, as well as organizations of like mind. It’s nice to know that there are others out there that share our vision for the future.

Our goal is to fulfill the contract . We’ve organized to form an organization that recruits, trains, and maintains members into the fold.
 
Ladies and gentlemen thank you for your time, and I hope to see you soon.

Privacy Policy!
===

[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]] | [[Mumble]] | [[Access]]

--------------------------------------------------------
The privacy of our visitors is of extreme importance to us. This document outlines our privacy guidelines, to which you agree by navigating this site. Regular updates of the privacy policy are completed, requiring you to check back on this policy from time to time.

Links on our site that belong to third parties may be found. These websites have their Privacy Policy, which you agree to when you link to the site. You should read this third party policy. We do not accept claims of liability or responsibility in any way for these policies or links, as we have no way to control the third party sites.

“A nation can survive its fools, and even the ambitious. But it cannot survive treason from within. An enemy at the gates is less formidable, for he is known and carries his banner openly. But the traitor moves amongst those within the gate freely, his sly whispers rustling through all the alleys, heard in the very halls of government itself. For the traitor appears not a traitor; he speaks in accents familiar to his victims, and he wears their face and their arguments, he appeals to the baseness that lies deep in the hearts of all men. He rots the soul of a nation, he works secretly and unknown in the night to undermine the pillars of the city, he infects the body politic so that it can no longer resist. A murderer is less to fear.”

― Marcus Tullius Cicero

"Recruit, train, maintain members into the organization!"

―Smith

He rots the soul of a nation, he works secretly and unknown in the night to undermine the pillars of the city, he infects the body politic so that it can no longer resist. A murderer is less to fear.”

― Marcus Tullius Cicero

Section13 Manifesto
===
[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]] | [[Mumble]] | [[Access]]  

-------------------------------

In the backwards world where we know the price of everything yet value nothing. Where does one go to escape the bonds that shackle them to a reality that was created as a voluntary prison. A prison one would openly embrace if the price was right. Does true freedom exist in a world dominated by UEE surveillance[[?]]

Brothers and Sisters of the universe. You are more powerful then what society would have you believe. More beautiful then the anorexic images that model the latest fashions to destroy your self esteem for profit, and total supremacy of independent thought.

When your innocence was destroyed by the addition of chemicals introduced into the “food” supply. Leaving you docile and susceptible to the mental manipulations from local, state, and federally funded media outlets. The world around you became corrupt.

The level of corruption is hard to quantify because it’s so rampant in our society. It’s easy to see how generations of people have been programmed at birth to accept what they see on state run media. Can we honestly say that we’re programming our people with the right types of messages.

Where did all of our citizen’s go? Will the plebs just stand by and allow this injustice to continue?

When using words such as griefer, troll, or dare I say PIRATE! Why is there this attitude of intolerance, hate, and avoidance. Have we as a society become so castrated that we can’t stand up for what we truly believe in anymore?

And the perpetual victim mentality, lolz. Were you really victimized by what someone said on the internet?

“You” people, and you know who I’m taking about here. Talk about this love, and acceptance, and brotherhood even. Yet it’s people like myself – as well as others who have had the courage to stand up for what we believe in. That are called trolls and pay the ultimate price. Banning a “troll” for disagreeing with what they have said is not the way you foster good community relations.

In fact, any and all attempts to “sanitize” our perspective will in fact empower us to go further. This level of hate that stems from the ignorance of our cause will only cast us as the evil we’ve always been. For you see our evil is of course yours as well. Only we have no issue with letting you in on our shared secret.

If your eyes should glance upon this text and it resonates with how you feel. There is a place for you with a pirate crew.

Our people are watched over by our patron saint. May she guide you along your journey.

A prayer to our patron St. Joan of Arc

“In the face of your enemies, in the face of harassment, ridicule, and doubt, you held firm in your faith. Even in your abandonment, alone and without friends, you held firm in your faith. Even as you faced your own mortality, you held firm in your faith. I pray that I may be as bold in my beliefs as you, St. Joan. I ask that you ride alongside me in my own battles. Help me be mindful that what is worthwhile can be won when I persist. Help me hold firm in my faith. Help me believe in my ability to act well and wisely. Amen.”

The history of our organization.
===
[[History]] | [[Manifesto]] | [[Charter]] | [[Mumble]] | [[Access]]  

---------------------------------------

Outcast from the community since inception, Section13 attempted to carve out an identity for itself in a number of ways. In what seemed like a perpetual state of re-branding we eventually came back to our roots.

Knowing that the universe was against us, we decided to operate our own pirate military corporation. Currently in development we’ve gathered some support from individuals, as well as organizations of like mind. It’s nice to know that there are others out there that share our vision for the future.

Our goal is to fulfill the contract . We’ve organized to form an organization that recruits, trains, and maintains members into the fold.
 
Ladies and gentlemen thank you for your time, and I hope to see you soon.

[[Wiki Formatting]]
=======
### Our Wiki supports basic markdown tags, below is a collection of helpful tags to help visitors create articles with style.

---

Paragraphs are separated
by a blank line.

Two spaces at the end of a line leave a  
line break.

---

Horizontal Lines  like this can be done with \***, \--- and \___

---

An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

        An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
        A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

An internal link like [[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].  

        An internal link like ​[​[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].
​
---

This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
[id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here"
[style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here"

        This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
        [id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here" 
        [style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here" 
​

---

![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")  

        ![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")
​

---

This Is A Heading
===  
        This Is A Heading
        ===

This Is A Sub-heading
----  
       This Is A Sub-heading
       ----
 
# This Is H1  
        # This Is H1  
 ## This Is H2  
        ## This Is H2  
### This Is H3  
        ### This Is H3  
#### This Is H4  
        #### This Is H4  
​

---

Text attributes:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.................... |......................|  
| _italic_  | \_Italic_  |  
|.................... |......................| 
| **bold**  | \*\*Bold**  |  
|.................... |......................|  
| `monospace` | \`Monospace` |  
|.................... |......................|  
​

---

   ### How to make a list:  
   notice the two spaces before *pears* and *oranges*. They will make it a sub-list.  

```
Numbered list:  

  1. apples
  2. oranges
    * pears  
  3. banana
```
```
 Bullet list:

  * apples 
    1. oranges
  * pears
  * banana
```

Numbered list:  
1. apples
2. oranges
  * pears  
3. banana

Bullet list:  
  * apples     
    1. oranges
  * banana                   
  * pears                       
​
---
### To make a code snippet:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ---------------------------- |:----------------------------:|  
|.................................................. |....................................................|  
| ``` The code you want to see ```  |     \`\`\` The code you want to see \`\`\`   
​

---
### Making a table:  
```
| Markdown           | Normal             |  
| ------------------ |:------------------:|  
|................... |....................|  
|* markymark *       | ​nonormal           |  
```  
| Markdown           | Normal                    |  
| ----------------------- |:-----------------------:|  
|....................... |.........................|  
| ** markymark **         | ​nonormal               |  
​

---
### Escaping a markdown character:  
As an escape char you can use "\" before the char you want to escape. This will make it read as a normal character and not hold any special meaning. Good if you want to write a \* for instance.

| Markdown           | Normal          
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.............................. |................................|  
| \*literal asterisks\*  | ​\\\* literal asterisks​\​*  |  
​

---
Further reading can be done at [GitHub's Markdown-Cheatsheet](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet)
​

---
